newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuania says gets BB+ IBCA country rating.
newsitem.headline: Lithuania says gets BB+ IBCA country rating.

text.p: The Lithuanian government on Friday said that rating agency IBCA gave it a BB+ country rating.
"This evaluation will allow the attraction of more investments at a cheaper price and will increase the trust in Lithuania," the office of Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius said in a statement.
The statement said that originally IBCA had planned to give Lithuania a lower rating of BB, which is equal to the Ba2 rating awarded last September by Moody's.
But IBCA increased its rating to BB+ after Finance Minister Rolandas Matiliauskas visited London earlier this week.
Matiliasukas explained the plans of the new right-wing government, voted into office in November, and provided the newest and most important data on the economy and finances, the statement added.
